info.title: RecurringApplicationCharge
info.description:
The RecurringApplicationCharge resource facilitates a fixed-value, 30-day recurring charge. You can create an application charge by sending a request with the name the charge should appear under, the price your app is charging, and a return URL where Shopify redirects the merchant after the charge is accepted. After you've created the charge, redirect the merchant to the confirmation URL returned by Shopify. If the charge is declined, then Shopify redirects the merchant and provides a notification message that the app charge was declined. For step-by-step guidance that walks through this flow using examples, see our implementation guide.

Note

For testing purposes you can include "test": true when creating the charge. This prevents the credit card from being charged. Test shops and demo shops cannot be charged.

Updating an application charge

Each shop can have only one recurring charge per app. When a new recurring application charge is activated for a shop that already has one, the existing recurring charge is canceled and replaced by the new charge. The new recurring charge is then activated.

For example, if you want to offer discounted pricing to a specific merchant, then you can create a new application charge for the shop. This will prompt the shop to accept the new charge in order to continue using the app. The new charge replaces the old billing going forward.

paths.description: Creates a recurring application charge. Make sure to include a valid return_url property to ensure the merchant is redirected after accepting the charge (an invalid or missing return_url propertymay lead to unstable behaviour in the charge approval flow).

response.body: {"errors":{"name":["can't be blank"],"price":["must be greater than zero"]}}

x-examples.name: Trying to create a charge without a price and name will return an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"recurring_application_charge":{"name":""}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/recurring_application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

recurring_application_charge = ShopifyAPI::RecurringApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
recurring_application_charge.name = ""
recurring_application_charge.save()

curl -d '{"recurring_application_charge":{"name":"Super Duper Plan","price":10.0,"return_url":"http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/recurring_application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

recurring_application_charge = ShopifyAPI::RecurringApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
recurring_application_charge.name = "Super Duper Plan"
recurring_application_charge.price = 10.0
recurring_application_charge.return_url = "http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"
recurring_application_charge.save()

paths.description: Updates the capped amount of an active recurring application charge. Note that you cannot use this endpoint to update  an [Annual subscription](https://shopify.dev/apps/billing/subscriptions/annual#limitations).
paths.summary: Updates the capped amount of a recurring application charge

200.description: Updates the capped amount of a recurring application charge

x-examples.name: Increase the capped amount for a shop

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/recurring_application_charges/455696195/customize.json?recurring_application_charge%5Bcapped_amount%5D=200" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

recurring_application_charge = ShopifyAPI::RecurringApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
recurring_application_charge.id = 455696195
recurring_application_charge.customize(
  session: test_session,
  recurring_application_charge: {"capped_amount" => "200"},
)

properties.description:
The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the customer activated the recurring application charge.
Note: The recurring application charge must be activated or the returned value is null.
properties.name: activated_on

properties.description:
The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the customer is billed.
Note: The recurring application charge must be accepted or the returned value is null.
properties.name: billing_on

properties.description:
The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the merchant canceled their recurring application charge.
Note: Returns null when the recurring application charge is not canceled.
properties.name: cancelled_on

properties.description: The limit a customer can be charged for usage based billing. If this property is provided, then you must also provide the terms property. See usage charges for more information.
properties.name: capped_amount

properties.description: The URL where the merchant accepts or declines the recurring application charge.
properties.name: confirmation_url

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the recurring application charge was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The ID of the recurring application charge.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The name of the recurring application charge.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The price of the recurring application charge. The maximum price is 10,000.
properties.name: price

properties.description: The URL where the merchant is redirected after accepting the charge.
properties.name: return_url

properties.description:
The status of the recurring charge. Valid values:

  • pending: The recurring charge is pending.
  • accepted: Removed in version 2021-01. The recurring charge has been accepted. As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant accepts a charge, the charge immediately transitions from pending to active.
  • active: The recurring charge is activated. This is the only status that actually causes a merchant to be charged. As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant accepts a charge, the charge immediately transitions from pending to active.
  • declined: The recurring charge has been declined.
  • expired: The recurring charge was not accepted within 2 days of being created.
  • frozen: The recurring charge is on hold due to a shop subscription non-payment. The charge will re-activate once subscription payments resume.
  • cancelled: The developer cancelled the charge.
properties.name: status

properties.description: The terms and conditions of usage based billing charges. Must be present in order to create usage charges, for example when the capped_amount property is provided. Presented to the merchant when they approve an app's usage charges.
properties.name: terms

properties.description: Whether the application charge is a test transaction. Valid values: true,null.
properties.name: test

properties.description: The number of days that the customer is eligible for a free trial.
properties.name: trial_days

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the free trial ends.
properties.name: trial_ends_on

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the recurring application charge was last updated.
properties.name: updated_at
